page.title: 10Boddington Manor
page.content: Boddington Manor was in the original Domesday Book. The Manor has been restored by the present owners.Mr. Robert Hitchen took over the manor in 1976,before him it was owned by a priest called Cannon Grise Hutchinson who died. Robert Hitchen gave his sons the business in 1976 and the manor became the head offices of the R.H.G. Nobody lives in the manor,but over 40 people work there.Around 200 builders are employed by the firm. The company builds houses and factories. The houses are sold,but the factories are rented. They build in Gloucester and Chelford. There are industrial estates in Tewkesbury and New Queddgley. The Robert Hitchins Group also has a large farm at Boddington (see page 9)
